title: Dim-Light & Moon-Light Workshop Series
short: A recurring day & night workshop series covering different domains with hands-on mini projects.
description: A recurring day & night workshop series covering different domains (Web Dev, AI, Cybersecurity, Cloud, etc.) with hands-on mini projects.

title: ByteForge HackFest 24hrs
short: A 24-hour hackathon where teams build tech solutions for real-world problems.
description: A 24-hour or weekend hackathon where teams build tech solutions for real-world or campus-based problems. Winners can showcase their projects to faculty and local startups.

title: Codesprint Challenge
short: A competitive coding contest with increasing difficulty rounds.
description: A competitive coding contest with increasing difficulty rounds, focused on logic building, algorithms, and data structures. Top scorers become 'ByteForge Codemasters.'

title: Capture the Flag (CTF)
short: An interactive cybersecurity event where participants solve hacking puzzles.
description: An interactive cybersecurity event where participants solve hacking puzzles, decode clues, and secure systems ethically.

title: Build-a-Startup Challenge
short: Teams pitch innovative product ideas and create prototypes.
description: Teams pitch innovative product ideas, develop prototypes, and present them to a judging panel — merging tech with entrepreneurship.

title: Open Source Contribution Drive
short: A 2-week guided event helping students contribute to GitHub open-source projects.
description: A 2-week guided event helping students contribute to GitHub open-source projects with mentorship from senior members.

title: TechTalk Thursdays
short: Weekly/monthly mini-seminars on tech trends and career insights.
description: Weekly or monthly mini-seminars featuring students or guest speakers discussing tech trends, career insights, or demoing personal projects.

title: PeerForge Mentorship Program
short: Seniors guide juniors in learning paths like Python, Web Dev, and Data Science.
description: A structured mentoring program where seniors guide juniors in learning paths (Python, Web Dev, Data Science, etc.) with goal-based tracking.

title: Innovator's Hour
short: Members share project concepts and get live feedback.
description: A 1-hour idea presentation slot where members share their project concepts or problem statements and get live feedback from the audience.

title: SkillForge – Soft Skills Bootcamp
short: Focusing on public speaking, teamwork, and professional communication.
description: An interactive session focusing on public speaking, teamwork, presentation skills, and professional communication for tech students.

title: Tech-A-Thon (Project Expo)
short: Students display and demo their real-world projects.
description: An exhibition where students display and demo their real-world projects to faculty, peers, and visitors. Best projects win awards.

title: ByteForge Ignite
short: Beginner-friendly orientation with fun activities and coding games.
description: A beginner-friendly event introducing students to coding, GitHub, and the club’s culture - with fun activities and coding games.

title: CollabConnect
short: Inter-college meetup to exchange projects and build networks.
description: An inter-college collaboration event to exchange projects, participate in joint hackathons, and build networking with other tech clubs.

title: ByteForge Diaries
short: Contest for detailed blogs or documentation of learning journeys.
description: A writing event where students publish blogs or documentation about their learning, projects, or problem-solving journeys.

title: Project Incubator Program
short: Semester-long program to develop full-fledged projects under mentorship.
description: A semester-long guided program where selected teams develop full-fledged projects under mentorship and present them at the end of the term.
